title: Pride and Prejudice
reviewText: Austen's wit and critique of societal expectations are as delightful and relevant as ever.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
reviewText: Salinger's portrayal of teenage alienation and loss of innocence is thought-provoking.
Orwell's chilling vision of totalitarianism remains hauntingly relevant even today.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
reviewText: Harper Lee delivers a powerful narrative on justice, race, and moral growth in America.

title: The Great Gatsby
reviewText: Fitzgerald’s portrayal of the Jazz Age and the American dream is both dazzling and tragic.

title: Moby Dick
reviewText: Melville's epic tale of obsession and revenge, filled with philosophical depth and vivid descriptions.

title: The Hobbit
reviewText: A light-hearted prelude to The Lord of the Rings, packed with adventure, humor, and heart.

title: Frankenstein
reviewText: Mary Shelley explores the dangers of unchecked ambition and scientific overreach.

title: Jane Eyre
reviewText: Charlotte Brontë delivers a rich, emotional journey of resilience, love, and independence.

title: The Alchemist
reviewText: Paulo Coelho's simple but powerful fable about following one's dreams resonates universally.
